metadata.title: CVE-2020-1774 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
When user downloads PGP or S/MIME keys/certificates, exported file has samename for private and public keys. Therefore it's possible to mix them andto send private key to the third-party instead of public key. This issueaffects ((OTRS)) Community Edition: 5.0.42 and prior versions, 6.0.27 andprior versions. OTRS: 7.0.16 and prior versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1774` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

otrs - 6.0.28-1
otrs2 - 6.0.28-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: otrs2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.28-1').
